author: Republic_Commando_Sev
title: Deadly Crossfire!
review:
Kongu is awesome! Some people don't like him because he's wide but, I LIKE HIM! I don't think he's to wide! I love how he has TWO Cordak Blasters! I love his mask and how lego did his tubing! Defanently Five Stars!
Republic Commando Sev

author: DarkLordMakuta
title: Kongu
review: Basically, it's a cool set, but he seems a tad bulky for a Toa of Air. The Cordak blasters, though cool, weigh down his arms, making him difficult to pose. The new tube part is pretty cool, though his head is bizarre.

review: this set first of all he is smaller than the inika form the air hose way is funky he has to cordak blasters they fire fine but what happens to him when he runs out of ammo i like the mask and i think kungo has this most pieces of the mahri i might get it

author: cys07gz
title: Buy this set, only it has two launchers.
review:
I used to buy all Bionicles sets of the year for my children, but then they first stopped building them, and they stopped asking altogether since about 2 years ago.  LEGO, beware, that tells something.

For the 2007 models, I only bought this one - for myself - because this is the only one that has two rocket launchers.  Kongu was assembled then boxed again, but the launchers are great fun.  After you get the feel on how to fire them, they can be used for a lot of games, with or without Lego.

Good luck to Lego with the Bionicle series. There are more than a hundred in my home.

author: Nate_Wan
title: The Gunner Returns!
review: I personally think this is my favorite Toa Mahri. True to his last incarnation his only weapons are projectiles which I love. Her also has the best color scheme with the dark green and metru gray pieces. Kongu is the best character suited for using his canister part as a base seeing as he has both cordaks. I don't see why people complain about the cordaks becasue both on this set worked perfectly for me and I enjoy firing both of them at my sister simaltaneously. Though he is abit bulky to be the most agile I love his new body piece so 9/10

author: hedgehog_lover
title: When the enemy gets close, its time to flee
review:
Hi everyone, its time to review Toa Kongu!To start I will say that I didn't have very high expectations of the toa mahri so I only got Kongu and Hahli. Looking back I wish I had bought the rest of them, even though I think Lego mixed up nuparu and Kongu. But what heck,he has TWO kordak blasters,TWO man,Two!
 Pros-
mask 
blasters(even thiugh they don't always work)
Body
Pipes leading into mask
 Cons-
Blasters are heavy and hard to pose
Heavy weaponry dosn't seem  fitting for a toa of air

4/5
Buy if-you like toa,want a good set or are collecting an arsenal of kordak blasters.
Don't buy if-you don't like water or prefer sets with close range weapons.

author: BionicleBOOM
title: Two Cordak Launchers!!
review:
It's fun to completely "obliterate" a target with two blasters fired from one Toa!!  I think the two blasters are the highlight of this set.  His mask power is cool, too, but the mask itself is kinda funny, weird, and silly all at once with the green, transparent tub on the back of his head.  He's also a little short and stubby for a Toa of Air.  An organized list is as follows:

Pros:

-Mask power

-TWO CORDAK BLASTERS YAY!! :D

-Four replacement rockets

Cons:

-Stubby and wide for a Toa of Air

-Silly tub on the back of his head

He's worth ten dollars, of course, but still think before you buy.  Get Hahli if you're undecided! :D

author: frycook49
title: Double the Blasters, Double the fun!
review: I got this for my birthday in 2009, and I really liked it! The mask was cool, and two Cordak Blasters are really nice, and very helpful in MOCs. It goes well with the other Toa Mahri, and makes a very nice display. Sometimes Kongu falls over if he is holding both his blasters, but it is a fantastic set, and I recommend if your a Bionicle fan

author: LEGOFREAK01
title: One of your "shorter" toa...
review:
Okay, so the title is pretty self-explanatory, so what? anyway, what features does he have you may ask? well, he has TWO cordak blasters and a BIG light in the back of his head but i just have no clue what that thing in the back of his head is but like I said I think it's a light... 

 Anyway, those ARE his only features besides that he has a new body. Well, he also (obviously) has a new mask like all the others. anyway, onto the pros-cons!

Pros

  • -great new mask!
  • -TWO cordak blasters!

Cons

  • -WAY to short...
  • -armor falls off prety easily...
  • -cordak blasters falls off easily too
So, if you don't have any other mahri, then you should definitely buy one of the others before you buy him... anyway, I hope my review was helpful! -LEGOFREAK01

author: Zatth
title: Kongu: Teach them Barraki the true Meaning of Crossfire!
review:
My name, Zatth, exemplifies my feelings for Bionicle. I was always a huge fan of the sets and the story since 2004, when I was old enough to get really interested. But, enough about me.

As you can guess, my username (which is the same name as Kongu's mask), should tell how I love Kongu Mahri.

And I certainly am impressed with him, as I am with all the Mahri. Kongu is a good sized toa. With his arms raised or stretched out he looks extremely tall and imposing. His build was a good choice by the designers. His bulkiness may at first seem odd for a Toa of Air, but this added weight and stability means that he can balance his long arms and heavy weaponry on their ends quite well, making him great for posing.

And he is great for posing. If you like stick 'em up shots or just action shots in general, Kongu make for a great display model. If you want to photograph him well, though, I would suggest shooting him at an angle with his eyes visible to you.

Beyond poseability, there is playability. I must say that melee weapons are often better for play, but Kongu is a good exception. His impressive size and truly heavy artillery that he's toting can really make the difference in a battle. (I was always a fan of overkill ranged weaponry). He can pop in on the Barraki's party and completely obliterate them with his Cordak blasters. Even better is when you own another Mahri, then his melee-less woes are solved.

There are just a couple cons with Kongu. (Pun intended).

His head: Hi head and mask are a sleek design, just great for a Toa of Air. But they do pose poseability problems. (Another pun intended). They're hard to turn, because of his hunched look, which don't exactly befit a Toa of Air. Not as bad as Mahri Hewkii's though. And, as mentioned before, there is the no-melee-weapons factor. This poses advantages and disadvantages, so if you like melee weapons, I would suggest another Mahri.

Nonetheless, Kongu is a fantastic and is wonderful fun to add to any bionicle collection. I was able to buy him from a friend for 10 dollars, if you can get him within a reasonable price for you, then by all means, get him. You won't be sorry. Cheers!

author: KLOKRIECHER
title: LEGO BIONICLE (Toa Mahri) - Toa Kongu Review
review:
This is a great figure to have and it's fun to play with as well.

Parts

This set has 74 pieces and it was 10 USD when it was on sale. That means that the price per piece ratio was 14 cents per piece which is a really good value for what we got here.

The build

The build is very nice and easy and we also don't need to worry about stickers.

The completed model

[img]http://www.klokriecher.de/gallery_pics/l/8910-1.jpg[/img]


The arms, the hands, the legs, the feet and the head can be adjusted. On both hands we can see a turret. The only two things which I don't like about this set is that the turret doesn't really work and that the box can be messed up very easily if you want to open it.

Summary

All in all this set is an great set and I would HIGHLY recommend you to get this. You can find this set on eBay, BrickLink and Amazon for sure. Here is the link where you can check out the full gallery I made for this set on my website: http://www.klokriecher.de


Videos I made of this set:

Stopmotion

Review

author: ZeldaTheSwordsman
title: Disappointing and odd, to my thinking, but I understand the appeal
review:
Kongu dates back to the launch of the line. His first appearance was as one of the six McDonald's Matoran. He had a lime green body, a teal Kanohi Miru, and was armed with a humble Bamboo Disk. After that, he didn't appear again for a while - the Le-Matoran and Onu-Matoran were left out of the 2003 Matoran releases. But in 2006, he along with three of his fellow McDonald's-originated Matoran plus Hahli and Nuparu were mutated and powered up into Toa, gaining new masks, powers, and weapons (in his case, a sword/crossbow). In 2007, the same team chased the ever-troublemaking Mask of Life into the depths of the ocean - and got mutated again to aquatic-adapted forms.

Box/Instructions

Being a Toa Mahri, Kongu comes in a box in a plastic frame rather than a cannister. His instructions are clear and easy to follow. While as is sadly to be expected for a post-2005 Toa, there are no alternate-model instructions, there is at least an inventory.

Parts

Kongu comes with assorted pins, axle-pins, and red 2-length axles, two dark green Toa Hordika right arms, a dark green torso piece that only came in one other set (and was a different color there) an astromech body/fuel tank piece, dark green Toa Metru kneecaps, Toa Inika thigh armor, and Rahkshi feet, dark bluish-gray Vahki legs, Toa Metru legs, horseshoe joints, a dark bluish-gray Toa Metru waist piece, a Toa Metru head, a shorter eyepiece for the Toa Metru head that has an axle socket in the back, a translucent green dome, a silver hose and Toa Metru chestplate, Kanohi Zatth, the Mask of Summoning (Which, much like its predecessor the Kanohi Suletu, resembles a mutated Kanohi Miru. The Zatth gives him a cheap knockoff version of Aquaman's signature power - he can summon creatures, but can't choose or command what he summons. Like all the Toa Mahri masks, it also marks a return to standard-style masks), sixteen Cordak bullets... and two Cordak blasters. Note what is conspicuous in absence.

Minifigures

N/A

The build

Kongu has a slightly more complex torso build than is common for Toa from this era, as the balls for the shoulder joints are supplied via the Hordika limbs rather than being integrated into a torso piece. He also takes the unusual route for the Mahri of building the air-recycling tank onto the back of his head, hence the special eyepiece. Otherwise, not much to discuss about the build. It's simple enough, and sadly like the previous year it lacks any true Technic gimmicks.

The completed model

The completed Toa Mahri Kongu is hunchbacked, and has his arms angled backwards to easily support the twin Cordak blasters that are his weapons. He's a mix of dark green, and dark bluish gray, and stands well. The ball joints give him a decent range of articulation, and his look is overall solid. Extra bullets for the Cordak blasters are tucked into his arms.

Overall opinion

There are things I like about Toa Mahri Kongu, and things that bug me about Toa Mahri Kongu. I like his mask, it's very stylish and the fact that it keeps up the resemblance to the mask Kongu originally wore is another plus about it. The predominantly dark green color scheme doesn't bother me with him like it does with Toa Matau - it actually feels appropriate here because of the "Aquatic mutation" theme. The rebreather tank in the back of his head is also neat and fits with the contours of the mask, although it does mean sacrificing light-piping.

The first and most glaring thing that bothers me is the lack of a Toa Tool. Every full-size Toa set released up to this point, had included a unique Toa Tool (or sometimes a pair thereof) for that Toa to wield (granted, the Toa Hagah's spears recycled existing parts toolings for the heads, but still). That Kongu does not have one and instead just comes with a second Cordak blaster is fairly disappointing. Another thing that kinda bugs me, but mainly just has me tilting my head a bit, is his lesser height and his posture - such has generally been the province of Earth Toa (heck, even Whenua's Toa form was built shorter than his teammates), so having him be short while Nuparu is still lanky feels rather odd. The lack of Technic gimmickry and the somewhat-reduced alt-build potential is also a disappointment for me, but that's because those had been among the main draws for me when it came to the toys. The lack of a cannister is also a bummer.. ah well, resealable sandwich bags to the rescue I suppose.

As Kongu is the first Toa Mahri I'm reviewing, I'll also give my thoughts on the Cordak blaster. It looks cool, and the concept is cool, but it does have its downsides. It doesn't have too many options for connecting it to other parts, it's bulky and heavy, the firing mechanism isn't always reliable, and unlike the previous year's Zamor Sphere launchers, it's rather weak. But it does at least have looks and can be fun to fire (unlike, say, the Thornax launcher).

All in all, Kongu is more-or-less passable in my book. I say more-or-less because the lack of his own unique Toa Tool is a major disappointment, but there have been worse. He's got good looks and articulation, so if that's what matters to you in a Toa set he won't disappoint, and if you're more into stuff like the Cordak Blasters then you get a double-helping.
